name: Classic Caesar Salad
description: A timeless Caesar salad made with romaine lettuce, croutons, and a creamy Caesar dressing.
instructions: Wash and chop the romaine lettuce.
In a large bowl, toss lettuce with Caesar dressing.
Top with grated Parmesan and croutons.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
cookingNote: For extra flavor, you can add grilled chicken or bacon. Be sure to use fresh lettuce and toss the ingredients gently to avoid wilting.

name: Greek Salad
description: A refreshing salad with cucumbers, tomatoes, olives, and feta cheese, dressed in olive oil and oregano.
instructions: Combine cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and olives in a large bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with dried oregano.
Toss gently to combine, then top with crumbled feta cheese.
Season with salt and pepper.
cookingNote: This salad is best enjoyed fresh. For a more filling version, add grilled chicken or chickpeas for added protein.

name: Caprese Salad
description: A light and refreshing salad made with fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, basil, and a drizzle of balsamic glaze.
instructions: Arrange the cherry tomatoes and fresh mozzarella on a plate.
Tuck basil leaves between the tomatoes and cheese.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze.
Season with salt and pepper.
cookingNote: This salad can be served as a starter or side dish. You can also add a sprinkle of sea salt for extra flavor.

name: Avocado and Chickpea Salad
description: A hearty salad with mashed avocado and chickpeas, perfect for a quick and healthy meal.
ingredients: 1 cup canned chickpeas, drained and rinsed
instructions: Mash the avocado in a bowl until smooth.
Add chickpeas, red onion, and cucumber.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper and toss to combine.
cookingNote: This salad is creamy and satisfying thanks to the avocado. You can add a protein like grilled chicken or tofu for a more substantial meal.

name: Quinoa and Roasted Vegetable Salad
description: A nutrient-packed salad made with quinoa, roasted vegetables, and a zesty lemon dressing.
ingredients: 1 cup roasted vegetables (zucchini, bell pepper, and sweet potato)
instructions: Toss the roasted vegetables with olive oil and roast at 400°F (200°C) for 20-25 minutes.
Combine cooked quinoa and roasted vegetables in a large bowl.
Drizzle with lemon juice and toss to combine.
Top with crumbled feta and season with salt and pepper.
cookingNote: This salad is filling and full of flavor, with roasted vegetables adding depth and quinoa providing a protein boost. Perfect as a meal on its own!
